forecast.time_left_until_outcome_known: About 6 weeks. The observation period is June 2025 and the outcome will be checked on or after July 1, 2025.
forecast.status_quo_outcome: No. Based on the historical data from the specified reporting source (NUFORC), a pilot report from South America is not a common occurrence in any given month. The status quo is that most months pass without such a report being posted.
forecast.no_outcome_scenario: The month of June 2025 concludes without any pilots flying over South America reporting a UFO/UAP sighting to the National UFO Reporting Center (NUFORC). Alternatively, a pilot may have a sighting but choose not to report it, or report it to a different agency, meaning it does not appear on the specified NUFORC webpage.
forecast.yes_outcome_scenario: A commercial, private, or military pilot observes an unexplained aerial phenomenon while flying over a South American country like Brazil, Argentina, or Chile. Influenced by the growing global discussion and reduced stigma around UAPs, the pilot submits a detailed report to NUFORC, which is subsequently published on their site during or shortly after June 2025.
forecast.rationale: This forecast is primarily driven by a base rate analysis of the National UFO Reporting Center (NUFORC) database. My analysis indicates that reports originating from South America are infrequent, typically numbering only one or two per month. Furthermore, pilot reports represent a very small fraction of the total reports submitted to NUFORC from any location. The combination of these two factors—a rare location and a rare witness type for this specific database—makes a qualifying event in any single month a low-probability outcome. Such reports do exist in the historical database, but they appear to be separated by years, not months. The research assistant provided no additional information, so the forecast relies on this historical pattern. My forecast is not lower than 4% to account for the global increase in UAP awareness and discussion since 2017, which may slightly increase the propensity for pilots to report unusual sightings. South America is also a region with a rich history of UFO sightings. My forecast is not higher because there is no specific information to suggest June 2025 will be anomalous. A probability above 10% would imply such an event occurs more than once a year, which is not supported by the data. I would increase my forecast if there were a major, widely-publicized UAP event in South America in late May 2025, as this could lead to a cluster of related reports.

prompt:
You are a professional forecaster interviewing for a job.

Your interview question is:
Will a pilot report of UFOs come from a country in South America in June 2025?

Question background:
For example, the resolution source [reports](https://nuforc.org/subndx/?id=x) a sighting in Brazil in December 2024.


This question's outcome will be determined by the specific criteria below. These criteria have not yet been satisfied:
This question resolves as **Yes** if The National UFO Reporting Center posts a pilot report of a UFO/UAP having occurred in a country on the South American continent, during the month of June 2025 at [this link](https://nuforc.org/subndx/?id=x) when accessed by Metaculus on or after July 1, 2025.




Your research assistant's report says:
No additional information available.

Today is 2025-05-21.

Before answering you think:
(a) The time left until the outcome to the question is known.
(b) The status quo outcome if nothing changed.
(c) A brief description of a scenario that results in a No outcome.
(d) A brief description of a scenario that results in a Yes outcome.
(e) You write your rationale remembering that good forecasters put extra weight on the status quo outcome since the world changes slowly most of the time. Explain your reasoning and the evidence behind your forecast in detail. Summarise information your received from your research assistant that influences your forecast (if any). Explain why your forecast is not higher, and why it is not lower. Outline what would need to be true for you to update your forecast in either direction.
(f) The last thing you write is your final probabilistic forecast as a number between 0 and 100.
